intro: Pseudostellaria okamotoi f. daegwallyeongensis, commonly known as the Daegwallyeong pseudostellaria, is a rare flowering plant native to South Korea. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. It has elliptical leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
